io.spine.server.tenant

Interface TenantIndex

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TenantRepository

    public interface TenantIndex
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    The index of tenant IDs in a multi-tenant application.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the index for further read or write operations.
      static TenantIndex createDefault(StorageFactory storageFactory)
      Creates default implementation of TenantIndex for multi-tenant context.
      java.util.Set<io.spine.core.TenantId> getAll()
      Obtains the set of all stored tenant IDs.
      void keep(io.spine.core.TenantId id)
      Stores the passed tenant ID in the index.
      static TenantIndex singleTenant()
      Obtains a TenantIndex to be used in single-tenant context.

    • Method Detail

      • keep

        void keep(io.spine.core.TenantId id)
        Stores the passed tenant ID in the index.

      • getAll

        java.util.Set<io.spine.core.TenantId> getAll()
        Obtains the set of all stored tenant IDs.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the index for further read or write operations.

        Implementations may throw specific exceptions.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • createDefault

        static TenantIndex createDefault(StorageFactory storageFactory)
        Creates default implementation of TenantIndex for multi-tenant context.

        Storage of TenantIndex data is performed in single-tenant context, and a single-tenant version of the passed storage factory. Therefore, it is safe to pass both single-tenant and multi-tenant storage factories to this method as long as the passed factory implements StorageFactory.toSingleTenant().

      • singleTenant

        static TenantIndex singleTenant()
        Obtains a TenantIndex to be used in single-tenant context.
